column4: i've got an interesting question regarding servers and ubuntu server edition
anyone know anything?
we do....next
update bios
I would take those 16 mb out first

well pull all out, leave 1 stick try. works - add one more and continue

common it's only 16 slots :)
even though bios shows all 450 does not mean, it correctly transfers (or whatever) them to OS
yeah, but the cover has a power-kill, as in I need to reassemble the computer every time to test
you can usually lock that one with screwdriver
i have no os...
but install is OS
it'll take an awl with how long the pin is on the cover... and good point on the os....
i meant bios may not correctly transfer ram sizes to upper level
is there a way to make it transfer?
i have no idea, that's why i told you to update bios..
maybe your ram sticks have different speeds, even though it is not supposed to be a problem.. you neve know
i've tried updating it multiple times... and the different speeds could be a problem... hadn't thought of that
that's also why i told you to remove the first, original stick, as I guess that one is old
yup.... I'll work on that.  I've got to go, but thanks for the help.
